natural problem:
The Benton Youth Soccer Team has 20 players on the team, including reserves. Of these, three are goalies. Today, the team is having a contest to see which goalie can block the most number of penalty kicks. For each penalty kick, a goalie stands in the net while the rest of the team (including other goalies) takes a shot on goal, one at a time, attempting to place the ball in the net.

How many penalty kicks must be taken to ensure that everyone has gone up against each of the goalies?
natural solution: For each of the $3$ goalies who stand in the net, there are $19$ other players who will kick to the goalie. That makes $3 \cdot 19 = \boxed{57}$ penalty kicks that must be taken.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes players :: nat and goalies :: nat and penalty_kicks :: nat
assumes h0 : "players = 20"
and h1 : "goalies = 3"
and h2 : "penalty_kicks = (players - 1) * goalies"
shows  "penalty_kicks = 57"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The Benton Youth Soccer Team has 20 players on the team, including reserves. Of these, three are goalies. Today, the team is having a contest to see which goalie can block the most number of penalty kicks. For each penalty kick, a goalie stands in the net while the rest of the team (including other goalies) takes a shot on goal, one at a time, attempting to place the ball in the net.

How many penalty kicks must be taken to ensure that everyone has gone up against each of the goalies? The final Answer is 57
 ### Proof
 For each of the $3$ goalies who stand in the net, there are $19$ other players who will kick to the goalie. That makes $3 \cdot 19 = \boxed{57}$ penalty kicks that must be taken.
 *)

theorem
fixes players :: nat and goalies :: nat and penalty_kicks :: nat
assumes h0 : "players = 20"
and h1 : "goalies = 3"
and h2 : "penalty_kicks = (players - 1) * goalies"
shows  "penalty_kicks = 57"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: "In a soccer game, there are 20 players and 3 goalies. If each player other than the goalie can take a penalty kick against each goalie, how many penalty kicks are there in total? The final answer is 57."

theorem
fixes total_players goalies penalty_kicks :: nat
assumes h0 : "total_players = 20"
and h1 : "goalies = 3"
and h2 : "penalty_kicks = (total_players - 1) * goalies"
shows  "penalty_kicks = 57"

Today, the team is having a contest to see which goalie can block the most number of penalty kicks.  ### Proof

 *)

theorem
fixes total_players goalies penalty_kicks :: nat
assumes h0 : "total_players = 20"
and h1 : "goalies = 3"
and h2 : "penalty_kicks = (total_players - 1) * goalies"
shows  "penalty_kicks = 57"

  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: If a soccer team has 20 players and 3 of them are goalies, find how many penalty kicks can be made if each non-goalie player can make a penalty kick to each goalie. The final answer is 57.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes players goalies penalty_kicks :: nat
assumes h0 : "players = 20"
and h1 : "goalies = 3"
and h2 : "penalty_kicks = (players - goalies) * goalies"
shows  "penalty_kicks = 57"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The Benton Youth Soccer Team has 20 players on the team, including reserves. Of these, three are goalies. Today, the team is having a contest to see which goalie can block the most number of penalty kicks. For each penalty kick, a goalie stands in the net while the rest of the team (including other goalies) takes a shot on goal, one at a time, attempting to place the ball in the net.

How many penalty kicks must be taken to ensure that everyone has gone up against each of the goalies? The final Answer is 57
 ### Proof
 For each of the $3$ goalies who stand in the net, there are $19$ other players who will kick to the goalie. That makes $3 \cdot 19 = \boxed{57}$ penalty kicks that must be taken.
 *)

theorem
fixes players goalies penalty_kicks :: nat
assumes h0 : "players = 20"
and h1 : "goalies = 3"
and h2 : "penalty_kicks = (players - goalies) * goalies"
shows  "penalty_kicks = 57"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: In a football team, there are 20 players in total, 3 of which are goalies. If each non-goalie player takes a penalty kick at each goalie, how many penalty kicks are there in total? The final answer is 57.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes players goalies :: nat
assumes h0 : "players = 20"
and h1 : "goalies = 3"
and h2 : "\<forall> player. player \<in> {1..players} \<longrightarrow> (\<forall> goalie. goalie \<in> {1..goalies} \<longrightarrow> \<exists> kick. kick \<le> 57)"
shows  "\<forall> player. player \<in> {1..players} \<longrightarrow> (\<exists> kick. kick \<le> 57 \<and> (\<forall> goalie. goalie \<in> {1..goalies} \<longrightarrow> kick > 0))"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The Benton Youth Soccer Team has 20 players on the team, including reserves. Of these, three are goalies. Today, the team is having a contest to see which goalie can block the most number of penalty kicks. For each penalty kick, a goalie stands in the net while the rest of the team (including other goalies) takes a shot on goal, one at a time, attempting to place the ball in the net.

How many penalty kicks must be taken to ensure that everyone has gone up against each of the goalies? The final Answer is 57
 ### Proof
 For each of the $3$ goalies who stand in the net, there are $19$ other players who will kick to the goalie. That makes $3 \cdot 19 = \boxed{57}$ penalty kicks that must be taken.
 *)

theorem
fixes players goalies :: nat
assumes h0 : "players = 20"
and h1 : "goalies = 3"
and h2 : "\<forall> player. player \<in> {1..players} \<longrightarrow> (\<forall> goalie. goalie \<in> {1..goalies} \<longrightarrow> \<exists> kick. kick \<le> 57)"
shows  "\<forall> player. player \<in> {1..players} \<longrightarrow> (\<exists> kick. kick \<le> 57 \<and> (\<forall> goalie. goalie \<in> {1..goalies} \<longrightarrow> kick > 0))"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: In a soccer game, there are 20 players and 3 goalkeepers. Every player kicks the ball at least once, and no kick exceeds 57. Prove that for each player, there exists a kick that is greater than zero and doesn't exceed 57, regardless of the goalkeeper.
